result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J. Husnick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from DOC
PLEA AND SENTENCING/ SENTENCING ON REVOCATION, Held on 8-23-18
Def's JU,NEJ,NOC mailed
(copy given to jail)

Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF21, 14CF75, 14CF251 and 18CF69 @ 3:43 p.m. Plea/sentencing on 18CF69, SAR on others. State has reviewed revocation packet, no additions or corrections. Def will need to waive prelim in 18CF69, copy of information given.  18CF69 Def will plead to cts 1 & 2, ct 3 dri. 14CF251 - 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 2 yrs es.  14CF75 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 24 mo es. 14CF21 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 24 mo es. All concurrent. 18CF69 - 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, concurrent to each other and any other. Credit for 38 days in 18CF69 and 140 days on each of the other files. Atty Kohn agrees. Def agrees. Atty Kohn has reviewed revocation packet, no additions or corrections. 18CF69 - Court reviews prelim hrg waiver w/Def. Court finds waiver knowing and voluntary, finds probable cause and binds over. Copy of information received, reading waived. Statement by Atty Kohn regarding max penalties on cts 2 & 3. State advises making corrections on information being filed electronically. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to 18CF69 ct 1 - no contest, ct 2 - no contes. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 3. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Kohn satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds Def guilty of 18CF69 cts 1 & 2. Court questions counsel regarding PSI. Sentencing remarks by the State. State advises on 18CF69 there is $1080 drug buy money to be assessed as part of agreement. Atty Kohn and Def agree. Sentencing remarks by Atty Kohn. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement on older files. 14CF75 ct 3 -3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 24 mo es, civil judgment for unpaid obligations. Credit for 140 days served. 14CF21 ct 1 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 2 yrs es, credit for 140 days served, concurrent to any currently serving and 14CF75. Civil judgment. 14CF251 ct 1 - 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, credit for 140 days served, civil judgment.
Remarks by the Court. Orders on 18CF69 ct 1 - 7 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 5 yrs es, ct 2 - 7 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 5 yrs es. All sentences concurrent. Court costs, DNA surcharge, DNA sample if not already on file. $1080 drug buy money as part of costs assessed. Credit for 38 days served. Def is eligible for SAP and CIP. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF251, 14CF21 and 14CF75 @ 9:47 a.m. PSI report has been received by both parties. No additions or corrections. State gives sentencing arguments. Recommends on 14CF21 ct 1 - withheld sent, 3 yrs probation with conditions from PSI report, court costs - no DNA surcharge. 14CF75 ct 1 - asks 6 yrs prison 3 init. confinement, 3 yrs ext supv, imposed and stayed, ct 3 - withheld sent, 3 yrs probation, concurrent to all probation, costs, couseling as in PSI report, ct 4 - 6 months jail w/credit for 102 days time served. State does not object to huber release. Court costs. 14CF251 withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, concurrent, same conditions. Response by Atty Roley, asks Court to follow recommendation of report. Asks on Ct 4 of 14CF75 - 102 days jail, asks Court 30 days to report if more jail ordered. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court orders on 14CF21 ct 1 - withheld prison sentence, 3 yrs probation, conditions as set forth in PSI, DNA sample if not already done, no DNA surcharge, absolute sobriety, court costs, complete programs/counseling as required, credit for 102 days served if revoked. 14CF75 ct 1 - 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs  initial confinement, 2  yrs ext supv, imposed and stayed, 3 yrs probation, concurrent, court costs, Ct 3 - sentence withheld, 3 yrs probation, concurrent, all probation same condititions, court costs. If 4 yrs prison goes into effect, consecutive to any other sentence ordered today and to Marinette Co case.      Credit for 102 days if revoked on ct 3  Ct 4 - time served, sentence completed,(vertified with Judge, 102 days) court costs -No DNA surcharge, pmt plan. 14CF251 ct 1 - withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation, concurrent, court costs, same condititions. Credit for 102 days served if revoked.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def advised of firearms and voting rights. Postconviction rights. Def eligible for chall. inc. and subst. abuse programs.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Attached Documents
No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription, and then only in amount prescribed.

Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF21, 14CF75, and 14CF251 @ 9:12 a.m. Def will waive prelim hrg in each 14CF21 - Def will plead to ct 1, cts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in, pre-sentence report requested, both parties free to argue. 14CF75 - plea to cts 1, 3, and 4,  cts 2 & 5 dismiss and read in, pre-sentence report requested, parties free to  argue. 14CF251 Def wil plead to ct 1, dismiss ct 2, pre-sentence requested, free to argue. Atty Roley and Def agree. Court reviews prelim waivers, finds Def knowingly & voluntarily waives prelims. Informations filed. Reading waived. Court reviews plea quest. 14CF21 ct 1 no contest plea. 14CF75 ct 1 no contest plea, ct 3 no contest plea, ct 4 no contest plea. 14CF251 ct 1 no contest plea. Based on plea agreement 14CF21 cts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in. 14CF75 dismiss and read in cts 2 & 5. 14CF251 ct 2 dismissed. Court reviews constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties. Atty Roley satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Stipulate factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 14CF21 ct 1 possession of narcotic drugs, 14CF75 ct 1 felony bail jumping, ct 4 possess THC, ct 3 possess narcotic drugs, 14CF251 ct 1 felony bail jumping. Court orders PSI. Off the record for scheduling. Back on the record. Sentencing 10/16/15 @ 9:00 a.m.  Report to be completed by 10/9/15. Atty Roley asks Def be allowed to post bail as previously set, gives arguments. State asks bond be revoked, gives arguments. Court questions Def's parents regarding bond, questions Def about job. Statement by Defendant. Court will allow release pending sentencing if $3,000.00 cash bond posted. If Def secures written offer of employment from Marinette Marine, Court will consider lowering. Condition of bond stated. Bond will cover all three files.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in court  via video with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 14CF251, 14CF21 and 14CF75.  Bond has been set.  Court reviews files.  Atty Roley request signature bond, arguments presented.  Response by State.  Statement by def in regards to bond.  Court will continue bond at $500.00 cash.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Bail Bond
No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription, and then only in amount prescribed.

Defendant Kevin J. Husnick in court via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Calls 14CF21, 14CF75 and 14CF251 @ 1:02 p.m. Def has not been in contact with Atty Roley. State asks Court to vacate warrants and set $5,000 cash bond to cover all three files. Warrants vacated. State gives reason for bond request. Def explains was incarcerated in another county. Court questions Def. Def advised to contact atty and both to appear at next court date. 14CF251 to be set for initial appearance 7/20/15 @ 1:30 p.m. Other files to track along.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Copy to parties 6-2-15
